abstract: Some of the nation’s most influential financial institutions, including Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America, cut their political donations, even as Congress began to prepare for increased regulation of the troubled industry, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: Some of the nation’s most influential financial institutions, including Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America, cut their political donations, even as Congress began to prepare for increased regulation of the troubled industry, Bloomberg News reported.

headline.main: Banks Cut Back on Political Donations, Report Says
